results.title: Babies with bad hearts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Your life in their hands”.
Shows surgical treatment of heart defects in very young children, at the Heart Unit of the Hospital for Sick Children in London.

results.title: Babies need books
results.creator_credit: New Zealand Trade & Enterprise and New Zealand Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A mother, grandmother, teacher and children’s bookseller, Dorothy Butler believes that books should play a crucial role in children’s lives right from the first months. The film is an informative and entertaining introduction to 58 favourite children’s books.

results.title: Babies Are People Too (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An anti-child abuse film for young mothers to give them a better understanding of how their infants develop during the first two years and how behaviour is an expression of their infant’s needs. The objective is to make better mothers, and hence, better adjusted babies.

results.title: Babette's Feast = Babettes Gaestebud
results.creator_credit: Gabriel Axel, Bo Christensen, Just Betzer, Danish Film Institute, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Panorama Film A/S
results.brief_description: Exquisitely, delicately told tale of two beautiful young daughters of a minister, who pass up love and fame to remain in their small Danish village. They grow old, using religion as a substitute for living life … and then take in Babette, a Parisian refugee, a woman with a very special secret. Babette wins 10,000 francs in a lottery and spends it all on preparing a sumptuous banquet for her Lutheran employers and their friends. Based on a short story by Isak Dinesen (Karen Blixen). Stars Stephane Audran in the title role with Jean-Philippe Lafont, Jarl Kulle and Bibi Andersson.

results.title: Babes in toyland
results.brief_description: Santa Claus’s incompetent assistants accidentally make some giant wooden soldiers, which come in useful when a villian tries to take over Toyland. A musical fantasy based on the Operetta by Victor Herbert and Glen McDonough with music adapted and conducted by George Bruns and choreography by Tom Mahoney. Stars Ray Bolger, Tommy Sands, Annette Funicello, Ed Wynn.

results.title: Babes in Arms
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Babes In Arms is a delightful “vehicle” for the talents of Judy Garland and Mickey Rooney in their youthful prime. The source was the Broadway musical by Richard Rogers and Lorenz Hart. The title song and “Where or When?” are featured from the original score with other numbers used in the background score. The story deals with the offspring of out-of-work vaudevillians whose livelihood was shattered with the coming of talking pictures. The young ones decide to put on a show.

results.title: Babe: Pig in the City
results.creator_credit: Kennedy Miller Productions, Universal Pictures, Mark Lamprell, Doug Mitchell, George Miller and Judy Morris
results.brief_description: Babe, fresh from his victory in the sheepherding contest, returns to Farmer Hoggett’s farm, but after Farmer Hoggett is injured and unable to work, Babe has to go to the big city to save the farm.

constellations_other.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_other.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title: Babe: pig in the city
results.brief_description: The sequel to the 1995 surprise hit ‘Babe’ moves the action of the first film into the vast unknown of a sprawling metropolis. Along with the radical change comes a surprisingly dark undertone. What launches Babe’s adventure is an unfortunate well accident involving farmer Hoggett. Babe, along with Mrs Hoggett, must then head into the big city to drum up money and save the farm from bankruptcy. Once there the native duo are separated and Babe finds himself in a strange boarding house for animals. Although critics feared the film might have been too intense for kids, Miller’s film is full of compassion, pathos and unexpected poignanacy.

results.title: Babe [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Bill Miller, Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Kennedy-Miller and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the story of an unprejudiced heart and how it changed our valley forever. So begins “Babe”, the critically acclaimed, oscar-nominated film where the animals are the true stars. It is the tale of Hoggett’s farm where every creature has a purpose until the orphaned piglet Babe arrives and turns everything upside down. Cared for by Fly the sheepdog, he soon comes to think of himself as a dog. Farmer Hoggett senses something special in Babe and though everyone thinks he is crazy, enters him in the National Sheepdog Championships. This is a truly heartwarming tale about having faith in your abilities and being true to your heart.

results.title: Babe
results.creator_credit: Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, Chris Noonan, Kennedy Miller Productions and Universal Pictures
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1995
results.brief_description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Doug Mitchell, George Miller, Bill Miller, Roger Ford, Chris Noonan, Kennedy Miller Productions and Universal Pictures
results.description: Babe is a little pig who doesn’t quite know his place in the world. With a bunch of odd friends, like Ferdinand the duck who thinks he is a rooster and Fly the dog he calls mum, Babe realises that he has the makings to become the greatest sheep pig of all time, and Farmer Hogget knows it. With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.

With the help of the sheep dogs, Babe learns that a pig can be anything that he wants to be.
